programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: There is no surer sign that spring is here than millions of lambs being born across the UK. Charlotte Smith visits the Outer Hebrides to meet teenage farmer Archie, who despite only being 17, already runs a 600-acre farm on the island of North Uist. Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn is back home lambing on her family farm in the Scottish Borders. She grew up there, developing a love of animals and farming, but it's also where she suffered the accident that left her paralysed; something that's never stopped her helping with lambing. Veterinary student Olivia Linares is fulfilling a lifelong dream as she embarks on her first ever lambing season in Hampshire. And, in north Wales, there is a look at how wool fleeces might be helping to make the UK's next great wine.

programme.title: Coronation Tailors: Fit for a King
programme.desc: Patrick Grant visits a factory sewing thousands of ceremonial uniforms for the coronation.

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of how a prince became a king, told in His Majesty's own words.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S26 (20/30)
programme.desc: Martin and Dion track progress on renovations in Bristol and Blackley.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip (Naples) S1 (6/15)
programme.desc: «Naples»Clive discovers why Neapolitan pizza is the best pizza in the world.

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival (Belfast Mela) S1 (6/20)
programme.desc: «Belfast Mela»Colin and Edith join the festivities and try the food at Belfast's Mela festival.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders (Mussels Mayhem) S1 (6/8)
programme.desc: «Mussels Mayhem»The Coastal Defenders dive team clear shellfish from blocking a ship's pipes.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The big political issues of the day.

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Highlights from the latest round of matches in Super League. Current competition leaders Wigan are looking to cement their position at the top of the table when they travel to Hull FC, whilst second-placed Warrington have a home game against the bottom club Wakefield. Hull KR start the round in third place, and go in search of a sixth consecutive victory when they face Huddersfield, whilst the champions St Helens are in the south of France to take on Catalans Dragons. Leeds take on Salford and Leigh are at home to Castleford.

programme.title: Impossible S5
programme.desc: Game show in which players must avoid giving impossible answers to a set of questions.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz featuring probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Au coeur du cosmos (Destiny) (2/4)
programme.desc: «Destiny»Brian Cox seeks to understand the nature of time and its role in creating the universe.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee S8
programme.desc: A place in the quarter-final is at stake this week, and the challenges are all about lingerie. Host Sara Pascoe starts the sewers off with a fiddly pattern for a lace underwired bra and matching knicker set. With such small pattern pieces, there is no margin for error, and Patrick and Esme's eagle eyes will spot every mistake. The Transformation Challenge requires the sewers to take thermal underwear and turn it into daywear. Then male models fill the sewing room to be fitted for a pair of luxury pyjamas. One sewer wins Garment of the Week and another is asked to leave the Sewing Room.

programme.title: Flog It ! S13
programme.desc: Today Flog it! comes from the heart of Birmingham and its historic Museum and Art Gallery. Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant are searching the queue for the best antiques and collectables to take to auction. Paul Martin explores the Museum's worldclass collection of Pre-Raphaelite art and discovers the work of Arts and Crafts jewellery designers, Arthur and Georgie Gaskin. Paul Also visits Hagley Hall, the last great Palladian house to be built in Britain. Presenter Paul Martin Participant Thomas Plant Participant Christina Trevanion.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games wheelie luggage, or will they be tempted by the House of Games reusable coffee mug, which is brand new for this series?

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip (Lazio) S1 (7/15)
programme.desc: «Lazio»Clive spends the night in an ancient Italian ghost town.

programme.title: Les motards poilus : Cooking Trip en Méditerranée S1
programme.desc: This time, the Hairy Bikers are in southern France on a historical food trail with passionate locals.

programme.title: Inside the Factory (Mints) S7 (9/10)
programme.desc: «Mints»Gregg visits a factory that churns out 32 million mints per day.

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan S1 (n°1)
programme.desc: Erdogan's rise to power and how his initial popularity turns to mass protests against him.

programme.title: Colin From Accounts (My Amiga) S1 (5/8)
programme.desc: «My Amiga»The Echo Park gang are impressed when Ashley takes charge during a power outage.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: Eclair de lune
programme.desc: A widow reaches out to her fiancé's estranged brother, before starting to fall head over heels for him.
